page.title: 07Law and Order in Clevedon
page.content: The most common crime in Clevedon is criminal damage;house burglaries are also common.There are not many major crimes such as murrder(only 2 in the last 5 years).The crimes on the increase are(1)alcohol and drug abuse (2)offences with weapons.On average, there are 2 cases of stolen cars per week.Up to July 1985 the police had dealt with 248 notifiable crimes for the year.Clevedon has 15 police constables and one sergeant.The officers patrol their beat in a car, on foot and one even rides around on his bicycle. Offenders are sent to Horfield Prison (in Bristol).The most common age of offenders is in the 19-30 years range. The police try to prevent crime by... 1.Visits to local schools and clubs. 2.Visits to homes by Crime Prevention Officers(by Clevedon Secondary School)
